title: Safe Systems Offers New White Paper "Best Practices for Control and Management of Your Community Bank's Information Technology"
text:
Safe Systems Offers New White Paper "Best Practices for Control and Management of Your Community Bank's Information Technology" [September 01, 2015] Safe Systems Offers New White Paper "Best Practices for Control and Management of Your Community Bank's Information Technology" 
Click here to download "Best Practices for Control and Management of Your Community Bank's Information Technology" 
This new white paper offers community banks insight on managing their IT networks while being tasked with implementing new technologies and applications, plus documenting every change to meet regulator demands. Safe Systems' white paper presents five best practices that community banks should have in place to effectively manage information technology. 
Community banks' IT teams are stretched thin and oftentimes do not have the capacity to maintain systems and compliance standards. More institutions are turning to third party technology service providers and automation to assist them. 
"In today's changing IT environment, it is critical for community banks to deliver the same quality of service as the big banks and financial institutions in their regions," said Darren Bridges, president of Safe Systems. "Partnering with the right technology services provider can bridge the gap between new initiatives and everyday administrative functions and your bank's longer term goals for maintaining compliance." 
About Safe Systems 
Safe Systems was founded in 1993 to provide compliance-centric IT and security solutions exclusively to financial institutions. The company has become one of the leaders in the industry, managing hundreds of financial institutions representing more than $61 billion in combined assets, 1,100 locations and more than 25,000 network devices. Safe Systems' IT network management services are the bridge between the core and other third-party applications. These cost effective solutions include IT support and managed services, internal network/cloud design and installation, hosted email, business continuity and disaster recovery, compliance consulting, security services, and IT and compliance training. Safe Systems helps financial institutions to significantly decrease costs, increase performance, and improve their compliance posture.
